stimulusHtml:
© Art Resource, NY

The transformation mask is characteristic of work created by the Kwakwaka’wakw of the northwest coast of Canada because of its
choicesHtml: combinations of human and animal forms with fiber and feathers on turtle shell
bilateral symmetry and ovoid shapes with undulating outlines painted on wood
asymmetrical arrangement of red and yellow feathers secured to fiber net backing
zigzag lines and vegetal patterns filled with brightly colored glass beads on cloth
